hypothesis_content.title: Asian Session Low-Volume Breakout Failure
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC breaks above/below its Asian session (00:00-08:00 UTC) range on volume <65% of 20-day average for that session, the breakout fails and reverses to session midpoint within 3-8 hours as European/US liquidity enters.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack directional conviction. Asian session breakouts on low volume typically represent illiquid market moves that get faded when higher-volume European and US sessions begin. Market makers provide liquidity against these false breaks, creating reliable reversal patterns.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks Asian session range (high or low) by >0.8%
Breakout volume on 1h candle <65% of 20-day average volume for same hourly period
No major macro data releases within 2 hours of breakout
Entry on close of 1h candle confirming breakout (close outside range)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to Asian session midpoint (high+low)/2
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout extends by additional 1.2% beyond entry point

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of breakouts continue in direction without returning to session midpoint, or strategy shows negative expectancy during high VIX (>25) periods.
